intro: Dockrillia baseyana, commonly known as the white dockrillia, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Dockrillia baseyana is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its striking foliage.
